intro: Hieracium salevense, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Hieracium salevense is known for its ability to colonize disturbed or nutrient-poor soils in mountainous areas.
